Many volunteered to come in to learn how to make the virtual education experience more like the traditional one.

Staff members are working to disinfect and prepare schools to open on Wednesday, Aug. 12.

“We know there’s a lot of apprehension and concern with a lot of our families. I’m a parent myself, and so I know that nothing means more to us than our children,” said Assistant Superintendent Steve Griffin. “And we take that responsibility very, very seriously. So, we feel like school is going to be a safe place. It’ll be a clean place.”

Biocidal cleaners will be used. Classrooms will be cleaned every evening. High touch areas will be cleaned multiple times during the school day.
﻿
In this week's #NAFCSuccess, we take a peek inside the schools to see what is being done to prepare for the 2020-2021 school year.

Biocidal cleaners will be used. Classrooms will be cleaned every evening. High touch areas will be cleaned multiple times during the school day.
﻿
In this week's #NAFCSuccess, we take a peek inside the schools to see what is being done to prepare for the 2020-2021 school year.

Recently, many of our middle school families received electronic communications from the middle school counseling program. Much of the content was intended to provide parents with tips to work with their child to better understand current events and race issues currently being experienced across our nation. Though well-intentioned, the intent of the message may have been lost in the words they chose.

We have a long-standing and positive relationship with the New Albany Police Department and the Floyd County Sheriff’s Department. We continue to trust and appreciate our local police and all they do for the NAFCS schools. We are proud to have school resource officers in many of our buildings. As a team, we work collaboratively on a daily basis to keep our students and schools safe.

The conversations occurring nationally are ones that are needed so that solutions can be discovered and implemented. In closing, we’d like to encourage dialog, listen to each other, and make lasting change which will impact lives for the better.

History Will Remember When the World Stopped
Poem by Donna Ashworth

History will remember when the world stopped
And the flights stayed on the ground.
And the cars parked in the street.
And the trains didn’t run.

History will remember when the schools closed
And the children stayed indoors
And the medical staff walked towards the fire
And they didn’t run.

History will remember when the people sang
On their balconies, in isolation
But so very much together
In courage and song.

History will remember when the people fought
For their old and their weak
Protected the vulnerable
By doing nothing at all.

History will remember when the virus left
And the houses opened
And the people came out
And hugged and kissed
And started again

Kinder than before.

Romeo Langford officially introduced as member of Boston Celtics
text:
One of our NAFCS alumni is in the news this week. New Albany High School graduate, Romeo Langford was announced a member of the Boston Celtics at the NBA Draft on Monday. Congratulations Romeo!
